Resource Profile: ClientRegistryPatient

Official URL: http://hlth.gov.bc.ca/fhir/client/StructureDefinition/bc-patient Version: 0.1.0
Active as of 2022-11-14 Computable Name: ClientRegistryPatient

General constraints on the Patient resource for use in the BC Client Registry project.

Note
This specification is currently published as a Draft Standard on the ministry GitHub and is not intended for implementation. Feedback is welcome but readers should understand that there is more work to be done in testing the profiles and operations defined in this guide. For more information, please see the Future Plans page in this guide.

Patient is a core resource of the Client Registry FHIR implementation. Patients are returned by queries (Find Candidates and Get Demographics) and modified or updated by AddPatient, RevisePatient and MergePatient FHIR Operations. This profile primarily adds extensions to elements that the core Patient resource does not include such as business dates.

Usage:

  • Use this Resource Profile: AddRequestBundle, AddResponseBundle, ReviseRequestBundle, ReviseResponseBundle, SearchResponseBundle, SearchWithEligibilityResponseBundle
  • Examples for this Resource Profile: Patient/Patient-0-Example, Patient/Patient-1-Example, Patient/Patient-2-Example, Patient/Patient-AddPatient-Example, Patient/Patient-AddPatient-Newborn-Example, Patient/Patient-AddReviseOrMergePatient-Response-Example, Patient/Patient-BabyBoy-Example, Patient/Patient-BabyGirl-Example, Patient/Patient-GetDemographics-Example, Patient/Patient-GetDemographics-withHistory-Example, Patient/Patient-Mother-Example, Patient/Patient-RevisePatient-Example

IdGradePath(s)DetailsRequirements
invariant-address-type-1errorPatientAddress.type, if both, must not include any other types of addresses, i.e. no postal and no physical.
: address.where(type = 'both').count()>=1 implies (address.where(type = 'physical').count()=0 and address.where(type = 'postal').count()=0)
invariant-address-type-2errorPatientEach Address.type, if Address.type is NOT both, must be present no more than once.
: address.where(type = 'both').count()=0 implies (address.where(type = 'physical').count()<=1 and address.where(type = 'postal').count()<=1)
invariant-name-use-1errorPatientEach type of allowed Name.use can only be used once.
: name.where(use = 'nickname').count()<=1 and name.where(use = 'usual').count()<=1 and name.where(use = 'official').count()<=1
invariant-telecom-email-use-1errorPatientEach type of allowed Telecom.use for email systems can only be used once.
: telecom.where(use = 'home' and system='email').count()<=1 and telecom.where(use = 'work' and system='email').count()<=1 and telecom.where(use = 'mobile' and system='email').count()<=1
invariant-telecom-phone-use-1errorPatientEach type of allowed Telecom.use for phone systems can only be used once.
: telecom.where(use = 'home' and system='phone').count()<=1 and telecom.where(use = 'work' and system='phone').count()<=1 and telecom.where(use = 'mobile' and system='phone').count()<=1

invariant-telecom-phone-use-1errorPatientEach type of allowed Telecom.use for phone systems can only be used once.
